Class AddMovieController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.AddMovieController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class AddMovieController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable

    The Add Movie Controller

    The Add Movie Controller primarily deals with the employee part of the cinema booking system. Movies can be added to the cinema. Movie details include: movie title, movie image, movie description, movie times, movie start date and movie end date. Details on cinema theatre availability for each day and time for a particular movie can be displayed within the application and exported to a csv file.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Donal McLaughlin and German Malsagov

      • export

        public void export(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Export Method: Linked with the "Export to csv" button, a csv file will be generated under the file path: resources/exportedCinemaCSVfiles/cinema.csv
        Parameters:
        event - Generate a csv file of a list of movie titles, movie dates, movie times and seat availability.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the filename specified is incorrect, an exception error is thrown.

      • findMovie

        public void findMovie(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Find Movie Method:

        Display the cinema theatre room as a grid of seats. Movie booking files are scanned and booked seats are highlighted. Labels show the number of seats booked and the number of seats available.

        Parameters:
        event - when the movie title combobox, movie date picker and movie time combobox are selected (in that order) an array of seats identical to the customers view is displayed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the filename specified is incorrect, an exception error is thrown.

      • addMovieTransition

        public void addMovieTransition(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Add Movie Method:

        The Employee can add a new movie to the cinema bookings systems' collection by filling out textfields, datepickers and uploading images via filechoosers.

        Parameters:
        event - - button fired
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the filename specified is incorrect, an exception error is thrown.

      • uploadImages

        public void uploadImages(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Upload Images Method: A method used to navigate the user's computer's file explorer to upload an image onto the system booking system application.
        Parameters:
        event - Import a movie image into the application
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An exception is thrown when a file is not chosen
